results.title: Moon over Miami
results.creator_credit: Walter Lang, Harry Joe Brown and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: When two sisters (played by Betty Grable and Carole Landis) fail to receive an expected inheritance, they decide to pool their resources with their Aunt and head for Florida, posing as an heiress, a secretary and a maid in the hopes of ensnaring a couple of millionaires. Grable is soon involved with two, Don Ameche and Robert Cummings, but all is not what it seems. Ameche is just as broke as the girls, but woos gold-digger Grable with his smooth talk and charming ways, with genuine millionaire Cummings in hot pursuit. A bright and breezy song-filled musical, as Grable turns in some fine dance routines with the Condos Brothers. Fabulous comic performances from the cast help make this film one of the best Hollywood musicals of its era.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Walter Lang, Harry Joe Brown and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation

results.title: Moon man (K)
results.creator_credit: Gene Deitch, Morton Schindel, Zdenka Deitchova, Weston Woods Studios and Kratky Film
results.brief_description: Animated version of the children’s book by Tomi Ungerer, which tells of the adventures that befell a man from the moon. Bored with his lonely life on the Moon, he decides to join the fun on Earth.

results.title: Moon landing
results.brief_description: On 21 July 1969, Neil Armstrong and Edwin ‘Buzz’ Aldrin became the first people to walk on the Moon. Through a global satellite network, this historic event was broadcast around the world and united an estimated 600 million people in a single moment.

constellations_primary.name: Space, cinema and fakes
constellations_primary.description: Before and after humans stepped foot on the moon, outer-space and the stars have inspired filmmakers, artists and game makers to imagine what's beyond our atmosphere.

constellations_other.name: Space, sci-fi and cinema fakes
constellations_other.description: Magic lantern slides were used to entertain and educate audiences in home, theatres and universities. While performers told jokes and fairytales, travelling showmen unveiled exotic locations and scientists revealed the latest discoveries.

results.description: On 21 July 1969, Neil Armstrong and Edwin ‘Buzz’ Aldrin became the first people to walk on the Moon. Through a global satellite network, including the satellite dish at the Parkes Observatory in New South Wales, this historic event was broadcast around the world and united an estimated 600 million people in a single moment.
description_for_label: On 21 July 1969, Neil Armstrong and Edwin ‘Buzz’ Aldrin became the first people to walk on the Moon. results.brief_description: Separate images in red, blue and yellow of dancers using kinetic sculptures are combined with classical music to give a surreal and atmospheric visual image in this Doris Chase film. Choreographer: Mary Staton. Music: George Kleinsinger

results.title: Moon's men
results.brief_description: Without commentary, tells of the early morning shrimp fishing at Morecambe Bay, on the north-west coast of England. When the tide goes out, two men harness their well-fed mares, ride in a wooden wagon to the water and gather their nets filled with fish.

results.title: Moon
results.brief_description: Sam Bell is getting anxious to finally return to Earth. He is the only occupant of a Moon-based manufacturing facility along with his computer and assistant, GERTY. When he has an accident however, he wakens to find that he is not alone.

constellations_other.name: Blizzard, Bowie and the Bonets
constellations_other.description: Overwatch is the beginning of some surprising connections in this Constellation that explores videogame movies, cartoons, and music docos and shows.

results.description: With only three weeks left in his three year contract, Sam Bell is getting anxious to finally return to Earth. He is the only occupant of a Moon-based manufacturing facility along with his computer and assistant, GERTY. When he has an accident however, he wakens to find that he is not alone.

results.title: Moom
results.brief_description: Mum and I would laugh at how the Moomba festival was named after our deadly mooms. Moom refers to our bottoms. A digital story created to celebrate 50 years of Melbourne Moomba Water Fest.

results.title: Mony a pickle
results.creator_credit: Norman McLaren and General Post Office of Great Britain
results.brief_description: A short film publicising the GPO Savings Bank in London. Several film directors contributed short sequences. McLaren’s two minute sequence made use of live photography and animation of furniture and other household objects. The title is one half of a Scottish proverb whose approximate English equivalent is “Many little bits make a lot.”
